forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind 20 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 44 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 18 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night envelops Downtown San Francisco, the city is shrouded in an embrace of rain, the steady patter serenading the familiar skyline. The air is heavy with moisture, at a cool 56 degrees, while a southern wind whistles at a brisk pace, stirring the atmosphere with gusts reminiscent of a distant ocean. The rain, relentless and assured, will continue to pour throughout the night, contributing to a cumulative softness underfoot as puddles form and reflect the glimmer of streetlights above. The chance of precipitation hovers at a steadfast 100%, ensuring that the city’s renowned fog might mingle with the rain, though its presence is muted tonight.

Tomorrow, expect more of the same—clouds blanket the sky, with temperatures peeking at 62 degrees before they dip in the afternoon. The wind will still be lively, reminding us of the enduring dance between nature and city life. As the waves of rain continue to caress the streets, a light jacket layered over a warm sweater will serve well, while sturdy shoes will grant you safe passage through this wet tapestry. Given the weather, a cozy evening in a local café, sipping something warm and letting the world drift by, seems a fitting respite from the storm—embracing the lingering allure of this vibrant city in a time of tranquil chaos.
